entry.title: One Armenian soldier wounded in Azerbaijani incursion attempt

media:group.media:title: One Armenian soldier wounded in Azerbaijani incursion attempt
media:group.media:description:
üìçAzerbaijani units attempted an incursion yesterday at multiple sections of the line of contact in Karabakh. One Armenian serviceman was wounded. üìç650 truck loads of garbage have been removed from Lake Yerevan in a major clean-up operation. üìçCyprus Airways announced a new seasonal flight route to Armenia.

entry.title: Explaining Azerbaijan‚Äôs aggressive actions in Nagorno-Karabakh

media:group.media:title: Explaining Azerbaijan‚Äôs aggressive actions in Nagorno-Karabakh
media:group.media:description:
On August 1, from 9 am, Azerbaijani forces attempted a major incursion across the line of contact in several sections into Nagorno-Karabakh. CivilNet contributor and analyst Benyamin Poghosyan discusses what Azerbaijan‚Äôs strategy is and why Azerbaijan‚Äôs growing strategic significance may be changing Russia and the EU‚Äôs attitude towards Armenia and Nagorno-Karabakh.

entry.title: Lessons for Armenian tech success from around the world

media:group.media:title: Lessons for Armenian tech success from around the world
media:group.media:description:
Jumoke Dada, the CEO and founder of Taeillo, sat down with CivilNet to talk about the importance of the FemInno conference, which took place in Yerevan on July 30-31. FemInno, the first women in tech conference held in the region, seeks to showcase and empower women in business, science, and technology. Dada also shared her own journey as a female entrepreneur in Nigeria, and how she incorporated tech into her company, Taeillo, an e-commerce furniture and lifestyle brand based in Lagos.

entry.title: Former Armenian foreign minister reportedly denied entry to Karabakh

media:group.media:title: Former Armenian foreign minister reportedly denied entry to Karabakh
media:group.media:description:
üìçHeritage party founder and former Armenian foreign minister Raffi Hovhannisyan has reportedly been banned from entering Nagorno-Karabakh. üìçThe residents of Turkey‚Äôs Kars are in favor of opening the border with Armenia, according to Turkish news site Bianet. üìçArmenia received nearly $266 million in transfers from Russia in May, the highest amount Armenian banks have ever recorded from any country in a month.
